he.text: 拽驻 砖 {total} 注转 .  专爪 拽 转 砖 -{groups} 砖 .  注转 拽  砖?
砖 {total} 转转 注 {groups} 住驻转.  转转 爪注 注  住驻?
拽驻 爪 {total} 驻 -{groups} 转转 爪专.  驻  转  拽 砖?

en.text: The captain has {total} gold coins. He wants to divide them equally among {groups} pirates. How many coins will each pirate get?
There are {total} cannons on {groups} ships. How many cannons on average per ship?
The captain found {total} pearls in {groups} treasure chests. How many pearls per chest if divided equally?

he.text: 拽驻 砖 {groups} 住驻转,  住驻 {items} 砖 .  砖 砖  住 ?
转转 爪专 砖 {items} 注转 .  砖 {groups} 转转,  注转 砖 住 ?
拽驻 驻 {items} 砖注转  .  砖注转  驻 -{groups} ?

en.text: The captain has {groups} ships, and each ship has {items} pirates. How many pirates does he have in total?
Each treasure chest has {items} gold coins. If there are {groups} chests, how many coins in total?
The captain sails {items} hours every day. How many hours will he sail in {groups} days?

he.tip: 驻: 转专 爪爪 砖专!

he.text: 拽驻 砖 驻转 爪专.  拽专 {numerator}/{denominator} 驻.  拽 砖专?
爪转 砖 {total} 砖 . {numerator}/{denominator}  注 砖转.  砖 注 砖转?

en.text: The captain has a treasure map. He explored {numerator}/{denominator} of the map. What fraction is left?
The crew has {total} pirates. {numerator}/{denominator} of them can swim. How many pirates can swim?

he.digitValue: 注专 住驻专 {digit} 住驻专 {number}?
he.nextNumber: 住驻专 注拽 砖 {number}?
he.missingDigit:
住驻专 住专? {pattern}
(住驻专 爪  {lowerBound} -{upperBound})

en.digitValue: What is the value of the digit {digit} in the number {number}?
en.nextNumber: What is the next number after {number}?
en.previousNumber: What is the previous number before {number}?
en.missingDigit:
What is the missing digit? {pattern}
(The number is between {lowerBound} and {upperBound})

he.text: 拽驻 砖 {whole}.{decimal} 拽专 .  专 ?

en.text: The captain has {whole}.{decimal} kilograms of gold. How many grams is that?
The distance to Treasure Island is {whole}.{decimal} nautical miles. How many meters is that?

he.calculatePrompt: 砖 注专转 拽 驻:
he.connectionNote: 拽  砖拽专 专转 驻 !
he.subtractionTip: 砖砖 住专 注专 砖住驻专 拽专 注砖专转 注!

en.connectionNote: This is exactly what happens in the vertical multiplication algorithm!
en.subtractionTip: Using subtraction helps when the number is close to a round ten!

he.text: 拽驻 拽 {groups} 转转.  转 砖 {items1} 注转  -{items2} 驻.  爪专转 拽 住 ?

en.text: The captain bought {groups} chests. Each chest has {items1} gold coins and {items2} pearls. How many treasures did he buy in total?

he.whatNumberExact: 住驻专 住 抓? (住转 -{lastDigit})
he.betweenNumbers: 住驻专 爪 拽 爪注  {num1} -{num2}?
he.closerTo: 住驻专 {testNum} 拽专 转专 -{option1}  -{option2}?

en.whatNumberExact: What number is marked by the arrow? (ends in {lastDigit})
en.whatNumberApprox: What number is marked by the arrow? ({hint})
en.betweenNumbers: What number is exactly in the middle between {num1} and {num2}?
en.closerTo: Is the number {testNum} closer to {option1} or {option2}?

he.text: 住驻 注转 注 拽 {start} .  驻 {steps} 拽砖专 拽.  拽 转注?
砖  注 拽 {position}. 驻  注 驻?

en.text: The ship is at position {start} at sea. It sails {steps} knots forward. What position will it reach?
There is an island at position {position}. Where is the island on the map?

he.solveInOneExpression: 驻转专 注" 转专 .

he.text: 拽驻 拽 {num1} 驻转 -{num2} 砖拽  转, 注 {num3} 砖拽驻转.  砖 住 ?
转 砖 {total} 砖拽. 拽 {items} 住驻专 -{price} 砖拽  .  住祝 砖专?
砖 {children}  转.   拽 {pencils} 注驻专转. 住驻 注 {additional} 注驻专转.  注驻专转 砖 住 ?
爪 拽转 注 {total} 砖拽.  拽 {items} 爪转 -{price} 砖拽  转, 住 -{pants} 砖拽.  住祝 砖专 ?
砖 {rows} 砖专转 砖 {cols} 住转.  住 {perSeat} 住驻专. 砖 {borrowed} 住驻专.  住驻专 砖专?
砖 {groups} 拽爪转 砖 {perGroup} , 注 {additional} . 拽 转 -{divisor} 转转 砖.    转?

en.text: The captain bought {num1} maps for {num2} dollars each, and {num3} more telescopes. How much did he pay in total?
The store has {total} dollars. They bought {items} books for {price} dollars each. How much money is left?
There are {children} children in class. Each child got {pencils} pencils. They added {additional} more pencils. How many pencils in total?
Emma went shopping with {total} dollars. She bought {items} shirts for {price} dollars each, and pants for {pants} dollars. How much money does she have left?
In the auditorium there are {rows} rows of {cols} seats. Each seat has {perSeat} books. {borrowed} books were borrowed. How many books are left?
In the kindergarten there are {groups} groups of {perGroup} children, and {additional} more children. They are divided into {divisor} equal classes. How many children in each class?
